column4: but wouldn't it be more sensible to only set the bootable flag on the ubuntu partition at a later stage?
it's just a bit silly that if it fails, you have to manually set windows to boot again
and most people wouldn't know how to do that
that's why there is a support channel.
what if someone has a single computer?
it's not fun to have a computer that doesn't boot
and setting a empty partition to boot isn't too nice
in theory, the problem will be solved in dapper, where the install CD is also the live CD.
I would argue that installing OSs isn't for the timid, anyway.
`the issue is that the boot flag on the windows partition is unset, and set on the soon-to-be linux partiion
isn't ubuntu meant for the timid?
